quote_first: That night I lay in my jangling single bed across from Sammy’s and I watched him sleep, and then I stared at the ceiling. I got up and took a blanket and went and made a cup of tea, and lay on the sofa and tried to read one of the wrinkled paperbacks. I blinked my way through a hallucinatory half chapter, set it aside and closed my eyes. I woke and it was
quote_last: , and I winced my way upstairs and lay down in my bed, to be there when Sammy woke up again.
title: The Body Lies
author: Jo Baker

quote_first: Will, my fiancé, was coming from Boston on the
quote_last: train - the dawn train, the only train that still stopped in the small Ohio city where I lived.
title: Pretty Ice
author: Mary Robison
